Pre-Game Insights: Canada captain Saad Zafar has said his team intends to be ruthless as they prepare to take on Bermuda in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup Americas Regional Qualifier.
Canada head into the tournament as favourites with the highest ranking of the four teams taking part at nineteenth in the world.
Saad Zafar emphasized the importance of winning by good margins as net run-rate could play a crucial role in the round-robin format.
Canada have never been to a T20 World Cup and are eyeing an historic maiden appearance when the tournament takes place in the United States and the West Indies next year.
Zafar mentioned that none of the players in the current squad have played in a World Cup before.
Canada's players were picking up experience in the Global T20 Canada before heading off to the United States for some competitive matches.
Zafar highlighted the importance of the first game of the tournament against Bermuda at White Hill Field, noting Bermuda's home advantage.
